{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3331551,"name":"Liam Basilone ","username":"LiamBasilone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/liambasilone/{size}/180362_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T21:16:53.662Z","cooked":"

Hey y’all! I am currently having a problem with the code that is not letting me enable any of my CAN motors. It appears whenever I deploy the code to the robot and I don’t know how to resolve it. I can fully deploy the code and use it, but none of the motors enable. The error reads, “[Phoenix] This version of Phoenix is not supported outside of alpha/beta testing. Devices will remain disabled. Update the API version to a stable release.” I don’t know how to update the API or resolve this l, if any of y’all can help it would be much appreciated, Thanks!!

EDIT: Solved!!! It turns out my phoenix software was in the beta stage, Thanks!!

If you are using VSCode, open up the command palette and search for “Manage Vendor Libraries.” Choose and it will open a menu. Pick “Check for Updates - Online” and an option to update Phoenix 5/6 should come up.

JaiCodes:

Pick “Check for Updates - Online”

This will not work, as alpha and beta releases are fully separate from regular releases.

LiamBasilone:

I don’t know how to update the API or resolve this

First - what version of WPILib/GradleRIO is your project and vscode?
You can see the version at the top of the build.gradle file in the root of your project.

If it is a beta version, you will need to first update your project to a post-kickoff WPILib version (at least version 2024.1.1). To update from beta install the latest version of WPILib and then follow the instructions here to import your project.

Once your project is using at least the kickoff version of WPILib, then you can reinstall the 2024 version of Phoenix. Delete any Phoenix .json files in the “vendordeps” folder, then follow the below instructions to re-install Phoenix.

Phoenix 6

Installing Phoenix 6 (FRC)

Java/C++ Offline Download the Phoenix Framework Installer, Navigate through the installer, ensuring applicable options are selected. Showing the installation screen root Apply the vendordep via WPI...
